New Records: New Zealand maintained its hold over the points table with its third consecutive win in the ICC World Cup 2023
Key Match Events: Daryl Mitchell played a responsible innings and finished his half-century to increase pressure against Bangladesh bowlers.
Mustafizur Rahman bowled a wonderful spell of 1/22 (6) to keep the bowling very tight and ruining the plans of New Zealand batters to finish the chase early.
Kane Williamson smashes 50 runs to contribute strongly for the 246-run chase against Bangladesh.
Shakib Al Hasan provided Bangladesh with another breakthrough as Devon Conway is walking back to the pavilion.
Taskin Ahmed dropped Kane Williamson and also dropped Daryl Mitchell's shot which could have been a six.

Bangladesh bowlers are desperately chasing wickets now as the partnership between Devon Conway is getting comfortable and the longer these batters spend time on the crease, the chances of Bangladesh will reduce.
Pre-Game Insights: There is no pre-game insight in the given article
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand skipper Kane Williamson, Daryl Mitchell and Devon Conway led Kiwis to their 3rd consecutive win the ICC World Cup 2023 and the team stands strong on the top of the points table.
Lockie Ferguson is chosen the player of the match as he bowled a wonderful spell of 3/49 to completely derail Bangladesh batting and restrict them to a sub-par score of 245 runs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The spinners from Bangladesh have bowled good spells and kept the New Zealand batters under tight leash.
The match is slipping away from Bangladesh hands as New Zealand now needs 88 runs from 18 overs and they are still just 2 wicket down.
Bangladesh bowlers must grab some wickets now if they want to get back in the game as if the New Zealand batters played 45-50 overs, they will certainly take the game home.
Others: The dew factor is also setting in slowly on the ground.
The fielders are trying to convert these chances into wickets, if they want any chance in the game.
